title: Random crashes on 0.14.0 RC1

labels.name: E:Desktop Community Bugfixes MVP
labels.description: Misc bug fixes about communities that are due for the MVP

body:
# Bug Report

## Description

Hard to know what's going on for real. It just crashes randomly.

It happened to me 3 times in a row when the app was loading on login. Then one time later when it was doing nothing.

My guess is that we receive a signal and we don't handle it correctly and then it crashes.

This is what the logs look like most of the time:

```
INF 2023-08-23 10:31:42.596-04:00 received                                   topics="signals-manager" tid=250780 file=messages.nim:70 signal=messages.new messageID=0x2a66ce015d32936fcc799acbccb055a416c08bd0afeda28946864336e6f7bf65
INF 2023-08-23 10:31:42.596-04:00 received                                   topics="signals-manager" tid=250780 file=messages.nim:70 signal=messages.new messageID=0x83549c70da0b5f9a9795a67368e0390cf66282af36b7d915f94874f9794421da
ERR 2023-08-23 10:31:42.597-04:00 requested community doesn't exists         topics="community-service" tid=250780 file=service.nim:721 communityId=0x04b2a87e119964bf1b338a80f5aecf8f09aa6b246172c0951bdee0ca8ef1f402e5b90eeeb48d9539ec69886ecadb070cb1e81ccc7588a2b93968b172f832745ef5
SIGSEGV: Illegal storage access. (Attempt to read from nil?)
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

## Steps to reproduce

Unknown.

All I know is that this is my release account, so it has a lot of communities, including the Status community (the control node still uses 0.13)

#### Expected behavior

No crash

#### Actual behavior

Random crashes

### Additional Information

- Status desktop version: 0.14..0 RC1
- Operating System: Ubuntu 20

i've got several crashes with attempt to send a message:
```
INF 2023-08-23 17:37:53.450+03:00 history request completed                  topics="mailservers-service" tid=1784975 file=service.nim:183
INF 2023-08-23 17:37:53.452+03:00 history request started                    topics="mailservers-service" tid=1784975 file=service.nim:178 numBatches=0
INF 2023-08-23 17:37:53.452+03:00 history request completed                  topics="mailservers-service" tid=1784975 file=service.nim:183
ERR 2023-08-23 17:39:24.837+03:00 requested community doesn't exists         topics="community-service" tid=1784975 file=service.nim:721 communityId=0x0411424f9caf50bd7487495fcce6182c0a2fdd68f278f405f46d07c4607ce3084d0b1bfc9b5944e92e8283d0c7cc3838db5a51c29d1c013dbe05c3a7b53a0fc7fc
```

Ok, I made a discovery. I was finding suspicious that the "community id" was that long. That's because it's not the case, that's a chat key!

Somehow, we are calling `getCommunityById` using a chat key, which is obviously not good. Let's find the culprit!

This is another one I'm getting often when resuming from sleep with Status release build running for a while.

# App log

Wake from sleep is at **13:04:38**.
```shell
ERR 2023-08-24 10:53:44.988+03:00 requested community doesn't exists         topics="community-service" tid=569473 file=service.nim:721 communityId=0x04b4a9d94ee6e1a626592747f2c48d1785acc40d818e171a362619831aa2236651b5c7a2a808201d73a6fd3fc43eb808a8f605a4b5826a8e48d49d48e47a14d4c4
``` 

> that's a chat key!

It's the active users chat key. At least in my case it's my own 🤔
